Accounts Payable Specialist (12 months fixed term)

Company Name Total Tools Company Location Port Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 weeks ago Number of views 101 views

Job description

About the role

Total Tools National Support Office is looking to fill a 12-month fixed term parental leave position within our highly efficient and professional finance team.


This role requires an immediate start so to facilitate a seamless handover, so please waste no time in submitting your application.

If successful you will;

  • Deliver high volume invoice processing, matching and payment file generation
  • Prepare and process electronic transfers for local and overseas suppliers
  • Reconcile transactions
  • Monitor accounts to ensure payments are up to date
  • Contribute to end of month closing
  • Generate and maintain creditors files


What will you bring to the role?

  • Proven experience in a full function accounts payable position
  • Experience using Pronto, SAP Concur highly regarded
  • Advanced Excel skill
  • Ability to work autonomously
  • Exemplary communication skills
  • Proficiency in managing multiple priorities
  • Demonstrated accuracy and attention to detail under pressure


Who we are

Total Tools has proven to be a dynamic leader within the professional tool retail sector since 1990. As a company, we are considered the premier supplier of tools to trade & industry in Australia. The company has 70 franchised outlets, respectfully employs hundreds of people nationwide across all states and is expanding rapidly.

Our Support Office is a large contributor to the success of the overall store network. The Support Office is a vibrant, professional environment which prides itself on its growing range of employee value propositions including an active staff social club, complimentary end of month lunches, discounted gym memberships, periodic tool auctions and much, much more!

Total Tools is a proud equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All hiring decisions are based upon skills, qualifications and merit.

National Account Executive

Company Name L'Or\xe9al Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 292 views

Job description

L’Or\xe9al Australia is part of the L’Or\xe9al Group – the world’s largest pure beauty company with over 100 years of history and experience. We are a passionate team in a growing market, working to deliver our mission of Beauty for All through our local portfolio of 25 brands.

Our business is energetic and vibrant, underpinned by strong ethical principles and our belief that financial performance and responsible business go hand-in-hand. We are driven each day by our six founding values - Passion, Innovation, Entrepreneurial spirit, Open-mindedness, Quest for excellence and Responsibility.

The mission of our Consumer Products Division is to provide the best innovation in beauty to consumers wherever and whenever they desire it. Through its brands L’Or\xe9al Paris, Maybelline, Garnier, NYX and Essie, the division is focused on meeting the infinite beauty needs of all Australians. CPD team members are empowered and have shared ownership of business activities. The division also has a structure which encourages collaboration and cooperation between its different functions.

We currently have an excellent opportunity for an experienced National Account Executive to join our team to represent the L’Or\xe9al portfolio managing our Woolworths account.

  • Reporting to the Senior Business Manager, your key responsibilities include:
  • Building and maintaining sound business partnerships with key internal and external stakeholders
  • Responsible for the e-commerce strategy and optimising the Woolworths online beauty category
  • Assisting National Account Manager with category reviews, understanding shopper insights and evaluating business performance
  • Developing clear strategies to support business objectives and Woolworths category growth
  • Delivering all financial and reporting requirements
To be successful for this role you will have demonstrated experience in FMCG, solid business development skills, experience in financial reporting and a high attention to detail.You will also be an excellent communicator to be able to engage and influence various stakeholders and have a passion for ecommerce.

We are an equal opportunity employer and we encourage applications from people regardless of gender, ethnicity, religious beliefs or disability.

If you would like the opportunity to grow your career within a global, brand focused organisation, please apply.

This opportunity will allow you to work with one of Australia's leading Forex and CFD trading platforms, in an exciting and up and coming game-changing market.


What your new role will look like:

815908657:
[

Senior Front End / UI Engineer - Multiple Roles

Company Name Versent Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 weeks ago Number of views 112 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Due to continued growth, Versent are looking for more (6+ at minimum) talented UIEngineers to join our growing family.


Our Engineers work together within a project team, focused on key project deliverables following a 'common sense' Agile to maintain consistency and team velocity.


Our engineers will be generally working on or defining modern Software Development patterns and assisting our customers deliver features to their customers. We work within a loosely defined agile MVP mindset and the goal of shipping done done software.


We have an evolving technology stack, so the key to success is an openness to learn, grow and evolve. Currently we have a team working with Angular but exploring React and Vue. Based on this, we are looking for those with experience across React and/or Vue. Don't worry, I'm not about to start a line about 5+ years experience in Vue.js, we look for capability over tenure.

Desired Skills and Experience:

We are just looking for engineers that love to code - be it Angular/React/Vue - languages change, and you are keen to keep learning and growing.


For one of the projects the preferred framework is Vue but if have a preference for React then you would need to be comfortable to lead a reset, ie match what ever functionality has been built and move team to new framework.


  • Strong understanding of modern development practices and patterns
  • Exposure/Awareness of material design
  • Agile experience (beyond just rituals)
  • Strong ability to communicate and coordinate within the immediate development team as well as the wider community of teams
  • Strong sense of humour with loads of personality
  • Hunger to learn new things and humble to say, ‘I don't know/understand'
  • Experience mentoring other developers (eg. pair programming)
  • Needs to be comfortable in setting direction when needed

Benefits:

WHY WE'RE DIFFERENT

You know, work doesn't have to feel like work. In fact, we don't want it to. That's why we've cultivated an environment based on creativity. Because when people who care about their craft are given the freedom to explore possibilities without restriction, amazing things can happen.


OUR CULTURE

No cool cliques, just hard-working humans generating ideas and devising solutions in a creative, collaborative work space. Professional but not corporate, we believe success is achieved through strong leadership (without interference from middle-management) and an autonomous working environment backed by the moral support of like-minded peers.


Versent Values and Behaviors

  • People: We believe in a positive team with family spirit, because life is to short for anything else.
  • Customer: We create remarkable experiences for customers and treat them as you would wish to be treated.
  • Quality: Be Artisans who care for their craft and lead change through continuous improvement.
  • Reliability: Do what we say we will do when we say we will do it, every time.
  • Transparency: Full disclosure, integrity and honesty in all things.
  • Reciprocate: Give back and assist as much as possible, whenever possible.

Contact the job poster

Paul Jenkins

Supporting the growth of Versent by engaging the best talent. API, Microservices, DevOps, AWS, Digital Security and more

Trainee Accountant

Company Name 4orward Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 weeks ago Number of views 1,004 views

Job description

Who are we?

\xa0

4orward is a progressive professional services firm providing comprehensive accounting, financial planning and commercial consulting to a broad range of clients; businesses, high net worth individuals, partnerships to name a few. We are a dynamic team of 30 strong and enjoy the rush we get from servicing our clients. We pride ourselves on being ahead of the “curveball” and we enjoy working in a modern bustling office. Year after year, we continue to experience high levels of growth, and there are no intentions of stopping anytime soon– so now is the time for the right person to come on board and not only help us to grow but also grow alongside us.

\xa0

What are we looking for?

\xa0

We want a Trainee Accountant who thinks “outside the box”, who can provide excellent support our Accounting Professionals by harnessing their administrative skills. We want someone who enjoys contributing ideas and implementing processes that make life easier. The position will provide opportunities to develop your career and skills with support for progression to complete a CPA or CA qualification.

\xa0

To be a 4orward comrade, you will need to cope with large volumes of work, enjoy responsibility and able work efficiently and independently.

\xa0

What are your main responsibilities?

  • Data Entry and processing
  • Cross-referencing
  • Assisting with compliance with policies and procedures
  • Administration of internal systems
  • Client file administration
  • Correspondence
  • Preparation of financial statements
  • Preparation and lodgment of tax returns for individuals, companies, partnerships, trusts and superannuation funds
  • Liaising with clients via email and phone delivering first class service
  • A variety of other responsibilities as we want you to keep learning and be challenged
  • Assisting the Operations Manager with ad-hoc duties

What do you need?

  • An undergraduate degree in Accounting or part-way through your course
  • Excellent written & verbal communication
  • A desire to work in a team environment
  • A result driven approach to your work
  • Good judgment to assess situations appropriately before taking action
  • Outstanding attention to detail and initiative to solve problems
  • High technical and analytical skills are essential
  • Strong computer skills and proficiency in MS Word & Excel
  • Enthusiasm, energy and professional grooming

\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0

Why choose us?

\xa0

4orward provides their staff with new technologies, ongoing learning opportunities, and great camaraderie! We believe in the little perks and so our staff receives on a daily basis Jasper fresh ground coffee, an assortment of tea to choose from, fruit platters, Friday night office drinks and amazing staff parties. \xa0

We are located in Southbank and public transport is a breeze with a tram stop directly out the front. We offer generous remuneration packages to suit our staff’s experience levels.

So if you thrive on an eventful and stimulating working environment apply here or simply send your CV and a brief overview of yourself to lexib@4orward.com

Company Name Kaizen Recruitment Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 119 views

Job description

Newly created opportunity to analyse and forecast across a number of products and investment teams.



  • Leading Fund Manager. New created opportunity
  • up to $110k package (experience dependent)
  • Melbourne CBD


Our client is a leading Global Fund Manager and due to continued growth is looking to hire an experienced Finance and Planning Analyst. This is a newly created position and is an exciting opportunity to garner experience across a growing business.
\xa0
The successful candidate will be responsible for creating, maintaining and analysing business planning models, forecasting and preparing reports and analysing performance. You will also have the opportunity to liaise with a number of business units and be involved in analysing\xa0 new products.

The ideal candidate will have demonstrated experience from a funds management or financial services background within management accounting, business planning and budgeting. You will be tertiary qualified in a business degree and hold either CPA or CA qualifications. Post-graduate qualifications will be considered favourably.
\xa0
It is essential that you have strong communication and stakeholder management skills, advanced research and Excel skills, sound product and financial services market knowledge, demonstrate initiative and leadership qualities, possess the ability to multi task and work to a deadline.

If you are interested in learning more about this position, please contact Matt McGilton at Kaizen Recruitment on 03 9095 7157 or apply via the attached email link.
